body.p: To his excellency the governor ^of Ky^ B Magoffin Your Petitioner James York was fined at the Oct term of the Anderson Circuit Court in 1861 forty five dollars for obstructing a public passway. The evidence was that the road said to be obstructed had not been traveled for many years, though originally the road, That your peitioner ignorant of the fact, as a resent ocupant and owner of premices placed his fence out close to the margin of the beaten road, covering about half of the old road for a few paces, but the law is such that he had to be fined. He therefore together with the undersigned Jury who tried the case, pray that said fine be remited, by the interposition of your executive clemency
Your petitioner says the above statements are true.
G. W. Catlett J P A C

Names of the Jury
William. G. Mountjoy
Jas. G Jordan
Wm Thomas
Jas, C, Fidler
Jesse C Watefield
Samuel Saffell
T C Bettesworth
J W Bond
C. M. Lillard
Dudley Hawkins
John Major
John G. Jordan says he was one of the above named Jury, and knows all the names to be Jenuine.
Sworn to before me by John G. Jordan this 29th Octo 1861
Please if remitted, send to J S Littlepage Jr at Lawrenceburg and greatly oblige your obedient Servant

Anderson Cir. Ct
